result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachariah Montrell Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Zachariah Montrell Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting trial dates. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF1991. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Sgt. Marquette University - J. Williams. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams in court by video, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be set for status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams in custody.  Jack Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor count 2.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Zachariah Montrell Williams not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 6/6/2022. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/06/2022@1:30p
